channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Opinion: Jane Goodall helped humans understand their place in the world
item.description: Jane Goodall, the influential primatologist and conservationist, died this week at the age of 91. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on her legacy and love for chimpanzees.
item.content:encoded:
Jane Goodall, the influential primatologist and conservationist, died this week at the age of 91. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on her legacy and love for chimpanzees.

(Image credit: Bela Szandelszky)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Here's how the fashion industry is using AI to predict the next big trend
item.description: Once the province of elite fashion editors and forecasters, the art of figuring out what's likely to fly off future racks is getting an assist from AI algorithms.
item.content:encoded:
Once the province of elite fashion editors and forecasters, the art of figuring out what's likely to fly off future racks is getting an assist from AI algorithms.

(Image credit: Kiran Ridley; Olga Gasnier; Geoffroy Van Der Hasselt/AFP via Getty Images; Julien De Rosa/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: As U.S. pressure mounts, Venezuela's foreign 'hostages' face growing uncertainty
item.description: Dozens of foreign nationals are locked up in Venezuelan prisons, accused of crimes they may not have committed. As the U.S. ramps up pressure on Caracas, families fear for their loved ones stuck there.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of foreign nationals are locked up in Venezuelan prisons, accused of crimes they may not have committed. As the U.S. ramps up pressure on Caracas, families fear for their loved ones stuck there.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: Manuel Rueda

item.title: Lou Ye's acclaimed 'An Unfinished Film' remains unfinished
item.description: Chinese director Lou Ye's An Unfinished Film is not a masterpiece, but why do so many seem to demand it to be?
item.content:encoded:
An Unfinished Film.'/>

Chinese director Lou Ye's An Unfinished Film is not a masterpiece, but why do so many seem to demand it to be?

(Image credit: Yingfilms Pte. Ltd., Essential Filmproduktion GmbH)
item.dc:creator: Yangyang Cheng

item.title: Japan's ruling party elects Sanae Takaichi as leader, likely to become first female PM
item.description: Japan's governing party on Saturday elected Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line ultra-conservative and China hawk, as its new leader, making her likely to become the country's first female prime minister.
item.content:encoded:
Japan's governing party on Saturday elected Sanae Takaichi, a hard-line ultra-conservative and China hawk, as its new leader, making her likely to become the country's first female prime minister.

(Image credit: Kim Kyung-Hoon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: NPR's Student Podcast Challenge: Here are our fourth grade winners!
item.description: We heard fun and engaging podcasts on topics including how math teaching has evolved, what its like to disengage from technology, and, who has it better: kids or grownups?
item.content:encoded: We heard fun and engaging podcasts on topics including how math teaching has evolved, what its like to disengage from technology, and, who has it better: kids or grownups?
item.dc:creator: Jordan Owens

item.title: The Federal Election Commission is down to 2 members. So its work is at a standstill
item.description: The Federal Election Commission, which regulates campaign finance, has lost another member. But the FEC has actually been without a quorum for months, leaving the agency unable to do much of its work.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Election Commission, which regulates campaign finance, has lost another member. But the FEC has actually been without a quorum for months, leaving the agency unable to do much of its work.

(Image credit: Joseph Prezioso)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: 8 low-effort ways to make Spooky Season feel cozy and festive
item.description: Feeling exhausted this fall but still want to celebrate all the good things the season brings? We've got a list of simple ideas to make your lead-up to Halloween feel warm, restful and a little eerie.
item.content:encoded:
Feeling exhausted this fall but still want to celebrate all the good things the season brings? We've got a list of simple ideas to make your lead-up to Halloween feel warm, restful and a little eerie.

(Image credit: Stefania Pelfini la Waziya)
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: Legal experts condemn Apple bowing to White House's request to remove ICE tracking app
item.description: It's the latest example of tech giants bowing to pressure from the Trump administration. Legal experts say the developer of the app has free speech rights that may have been violated.
item.content:encoded:
It's the latest example of tech giants bowing to pressure from the Trump administration. Legal experts say the developer of the app has free speech rights that may have been violated.

(Image credit: Nic Coury)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Denmark prepares for a Russian 'hybrid war' after repeated drone spottings
item.description: Many Danes are rethinking their personal security, and stocking up on emergency supplies, amid unidentified drone appearances. Denmark's leaders warn that Russia is waging a "hybrid war."
item.content:encoded:
Many Danes are rethinking their personal security, and stocking up on emergency supplies, amid unidentified drone appearances. Denmark's leaders warn that Russia is waging a "hybrid war."

(Image credit: Mads Claus Rasmussen)
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz
